meanings.definition: Inducing or tending to induce sleep.
meanings.sent1: The somniferous music played softly in the background, lulling me into a peaceful slumber.
meanings.sent2: The somniferous effects of the warm milk helped the child fall asleep quickly.
meanings.sent3: The somniferous teddy bear seemed to have a magical power to make children yawn and drift off to dreamland.
meanings.sent4: The somniferous night sky sprinkled with twinkling stars whispered a lullaby to the tired world below.
meanings.sent5: The somniferous scent of lavender filled the room, creating a tranquil atmosphere perfect for rest.

meanings.sent1: The somniferous medication made her eyelids heavy and her mind foggy.
meanings.sent2: The somniferous effects of the long car ride made the passengers feel drowsy.
meanings.sent3: The somniferous lecture on the history of rocks almost put the students to sleep.
meanings.sent4: The somniferous sound of rain tapping on the windowpane lulled him into a peaceful nap.
meanings.sent5: The somniferous rhythm of the rocking chair gently swayed the baby into a sleepy state.
